class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: Deputies responded to a party where juveniles were possibly consuming alcohol. Fifteen teens between the ages of 15 and 16 were found to be drinking underage. All of the teens are from Ashburn. The Virginia Department of Alcohol Beverage Control was contacted and is investigating how the alcohol was obtained. Beer and liquor were recovered at the party. The teens were released to the custody of their parents. Juvenile Court Services will be contacted regarding the incident. C2008022318

Tamar Lynn Whipple 45 of Ashburn was charged with breaking and entering. The suspects allegedly went to a residence and entered the home with permission. The altercation was over a possible stolen piece of clothing. One of the subjects brandished a knife and another wielded a bat. One of the residents of the home was struck. C2008000015

class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: A deputy was conducting traffic enforcement in the area of Golden Springs Court when the deputy observed a vehicle driving aggressively. The deputy initiated a traffic stop and the vehicle made aggressive moves to elude law enforcement. The vehicle ran a red light at Berlin Turnpike and continued to drive well in excess of the posted speed limit. The vehicle continued into West Virginia and the pursuit was terminated and Jefferson County WV was notified. Three subjects were apprehended after a foot pursuit. The driver was identified as a juvenile who had fled from a juvenile facility in West Virginia. Charges are pending in Loudoun against the juvenile driver. C2009000163

All four were charged with malicious wounding and assault by mob. Seely was also charged with three counts of sexual assault and four counts of simple assault. All four subjects are being held without bond. C2007021681

class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: An unknown subject discharged a firearm outside of a Sterling restaurant. Sheriff’s Deputies responded to the Eight Ball Café for a report of a large group of people. During the incident an unknown Black male discharged several shots into the air. The suspect is described as being 5’11” tall 200 pounds. He has long hair that is braided back into a ball. A second subject Ryan Andrew Martin 23 of Sterling was charged after the incident. Responding deputies saw the subject coming out of the café. He was disorderly and was aggravating the crowd. The subject was detained and attempted to resist. He then kicked a deputy in the leg and began kicking wildly. He was taken to the Loudoun Adult Detention Center where he was charged with assault on a law enforcement officer disorderly conduct and obstruction of justice by force. C2008000012

class.name: ciras.db.Arrested
class.element: An unknown subject discharged a firearm outside a Sterling restaurant. Sheriff’s Deputies responded to the Eight Ball Café for a report a large group people. During the incident an unknown Black male discharged several shots into the air. The suspect is described as being 5’11” tall 200 pounds. He has long hair that is braided back into a ball. A second subject Ryan Andrew Martin

class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: A 19-year-old Sterling man was stabbed during an altercation at the Townplace Suites by Marriott. The victim was in a hotel room when an unknown subject attempted to enter there room. He was denied entry and a fight ensued. A group of Asian males then came out of another room and the victim was stabbed. The subjects fled in a passenger vehicle believed to be a black Infinity G35. The victim was taken to INOVA Fairfax Hospital with serious injuries. C2008000019

class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: Sheriff’s Deputies responded to the emergency room of INOVA Fairfax Hospital where two victims had arrived after being assaulted. The two victims said they were at a party at the listed location when they were confronted by a group of males wanting to fight. One of the suspects was described as a White male short in stature with black hair and a medium build. Both victims received minor injuries. C2008000054

class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: Two vehicles crashed head-on around 11:38 PM. Involved in the crash were Muhammad K.Shaikh 33 of  Maryland. Shaikh was driving a 2003 Jaguar. He was airlifted to INOVA Fairfax Hospital and remains hospitalized with serious injuries. A passenger in the car Yuliya M. Muryhina 25 of Ashburn was taken to INOVA Loudoun at Lansdowne with non-life-threatening injuries. Another passenger Severima Tatiama 24 of Connecticut declined treatment at scene. In the second vehicle Charles J. Carter 26 of Leesburg was driving a 2003 Volvo. He was airlifted to INOVA Fairfax Hospital and remains hospitalized with serious injuries.A passenger Daniel L. Kressley 27 of  Ashburn was taken to INOVA Loudoun at Lansdowne but was later transported to INOVA Fairfax. He remains hospitalized. The cause of the crash remains under investigation.

class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: Deputies were initially called to a residence for a loud noise complaint. When deputies arrived they discovered four juveniles between the ages of 16 and 17 who had allegedly consumed alcohol. They were released to their parents and juvenile petitions for underage possession of alcohol are possible. In addition Daniel Warren King 21 of Ashburn and Joshua Alan Litzie 19 of Sterling were charged with contributing to the delinquency of a minor. Deputies responded back to the same residence around 2:20 a.m. on January 3 2009 for a report of items taken from the home. The items including a laptop jewelry and an MP3 player were apparently removed during the party that was held at the house. C2009000091/000136

class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: Thomas E. Lusk 56 of Sterling was charged Friday for an incident that occurred on January 1 2008. Mr. Lusk was allegedly walking in the parking lot of the Potomac Run Plaza when he got into a verbal altercation with a female driver. Lusk apparently got into his vehicle and followed the woman to an area where she had stopped. According to the victim Mr. Lusk approached the driver’s side window and displayed a badge. The victim told authorities Mr. Lusk told her he was a police officer. After an investigation Mr. Lusk was charged with impersonating a police officer. C2008000034

class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: Stephen Andrew Schuresko 26 of Ashburn was charged with assault and battery on law enforcement felony eluding obstruction of justice and driving on a suspended license. The charges stem from a pursuit. A deputy initiated a traffic stop on a vehicle in the area of the listed location for suspicious driving behavior. The vehicle accelerated and turned onto Amity Place. The vehicle turned around in the cul-de-sac and nearly struck the pursuing deputy’s vehicle. The vehicle turned back onto Gloucester Parkway and eventually lost control and crashed into a parked vehicle. The driver attempted to flee on foot. The fleeing suspect then turned and struck the deputy during a struggle. The struggle continued until a second deputy arrived and the suspect was taken into custody. Schuresko remains held without bond. C2008000276

class.name: ciras.db.Crime

A Virginia State Police helicopter was requested for aerial support. A Loudoun Sheriff’s Office Bloodhound Unit was also requested for the ground search. She was found in good condition but was taken to the Lansdowne Campus of INOVA Loudoun Hospital as a precaution. C2008000581

The victim got out of his vehicle and was struck several times possibly with a blunt object. The suspects then removed money from the victim. The suspects left the scene in a white passenger car. The victim was taken to a local hospital where he was treated for injuries from the assault. The Sheriff’s Office Criminal Investigations Division is handling the case. C2008001818

class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: Gregory Jay Smith 47 of Purcellville was charged with destruction of property obstruction of justice eluding entering property with intent to damage and assault on a law enforcement officer. Deputies responded to a residence for a burglary in progress. The suspect damaged a window of a residence. The suspect was known to the victim as there is an ongoing dispute between the two. The suspect returned to the scene and was approached by deputies. The suspect drove away and was pursued by deputies. A deputy attempted to deploy stop sticks near Foggy Bottom Road. The suspect veered the car towards the deputy. The vehicle was eventually stopped when it returned to Buck Mountain Road. Smith is being held without bond. C2008002002

class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: Three female suspects were apprehended after a robbery of the convenience store of an Exxon gas station. One of the suspects Morgan A. Jennings 21 of Sterling was initially apprehended by a customer. Two other suspects Jessica M. Collette 30 and Rebekah J. White 20 were apprehended by a responding deputy who observed a vehicle matching a description given by witnesses of the fleeing suspect’s vehicle. A traffic stop was initiated on the vehicle and the suspects were apprehended. Sheriff’s Deputies were called to the scene after a reported armed robbery at the business. Jennings Collette and White were charged with robbery and use of a firearm during the commission of a felony. All three remain held at the Loudoun County Adult Detention Center. C2008002114

class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: A 14-year-old female reported she was walking on the trail when she was approached by an unknown subject on a bicycle. The man described as a Hispanic male in his late teens asked the female several questions. The female walked away and the subject grabbed her inappropriately as he rode away on a bicycle. The suspect is further described as being 5’6” tall with a short haircut brown eyes and a pierced right ear with a diamond stud. He was wearing a black zip up sweatshirt and blue jeans. A canvass of the area was conducted and no suspect matching that description was located. The incident is being investigated by the Sheriff’s Office Criminal Investigations Division. C2008003000

One of the more serious crashes involved a Toyota 4 Runner that flipped over on Route 7 at the northbound ramp for Route 28. The SUV’s occupants included two adult females and four children. class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: Loudoun Sheriff’s Deputies responded to the scene of a single vehicle crash on Rt. 28 near Rt. 606. Investigation in to the incident to date indicates that Richard Ching Chyn Pao 67 of Ashburn was operating a 2006 Subaru Forester on the ramp from westbound Rt. 606 to go northbound on Rt. 28 when the vehicle crossed the three northbound lanes and struck the concrete jersey wall and overturned. Several persons witnessed the incident and stopped to assist as Pao was still trapped in the car. Three citizens assisted the initial responding deputy with helping Pao who was hanging from his seatbelt in the car. The driver was initially was transported to the Lansdowne Campus of INOVA Loudoun Hospital. Pao was airlifted from Lansdowne to INOVA Fairfax Hospital with several injuries sustained in the crash. Mr. Pao is in critical condition at INOVA Fairfax Hospital. The cause of the crash is still under investigation. C2008003511

class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: A deputy observed a vehicle driving erratically in the area of Ridgetop Circle and Loudoun Tech Boulevard. The vehicle then turned eastbound into the westbound lanes of Route 7. The deputy initiated their emergency equipment and drove parallel with the suspect vehicle to alert oncoming traffic. A second deputy placed their patrol vehicle ahead of the suspect and initiated their emergency equipment. The suspect vehicle made a u-turn and returned heading east in the eastbound lanes of Route 7. The vehicle then accelerated when as deputies continued to conduct a traffic stop. The driver then turned onto Loudoun Tech Boulevard where the vehicle drove over a curb and into a grass area. Wualter Arias-Ochoa 21 of Herndon was charged with DUI refusal and felony eluding. He was released by a Loudoun Magistrate on a Personal Recognizance bond. C2008004904

class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: Two men entered the Tri-State Exxon and were observed removing cartons of cigarettes. A female cashier attempted to stop the men and was pushed out of the way as the suspects exited the store. The men entered a dark green Dodge Caravan. A customer who was pumping gas outside attempted to intervene and had to move to not be struck by the van. The van left at a high rate of speed and traveled south on Route 340 into West Virginia. The first suspect who took the cigarettes was described as being a White male in his early to mid 30’s with reddish colored shoulder length hair. He was wearing a blue jacket and blue work pants. The second suspect was described as a White male in his early to mid-30’s with dirty blond hair and a heavy build. He was also wearing a blue jacket and blue work pants. The driver of the van is described as a White female in her mid- to-late-20’s with blond hair that was pulled back in a pony-tail. She was wearing a blue baseball cap a blue jacket and blue pants. The case is being handled by the Sheriff’s Office Criminal Investigations Division. C2008005089

The crash caused delays on westbound Waxpool Road as the roadway was closed for approximately 1 hour. C2008005087

The pick-up was located abandoned in the area of Rootstown Terrace. Two 15-year-olds and a 16-year-old are facing petitions of Burglary with intent to commit a Felony. The investigation continues and other suspects may be involved. C2008006359

class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: Deputies responded to the area of Rt. 659 just south of Hay Road for a single vehicle crash. According to witnesses and examination of the scene Jennifer L. Miller 45 of Sterling was northbound on Rt. 659 when her 1999 Toyota Camry ran off the right side of the road corrected to the left and then overcorrected to the right causing the vehicle to crash into a tree--drivers side first.  Miller who had been wearing her seatbelt was airlifted to INOVA Fairfax hospital.  The vehicle airbags did not deploy.  Miller is listed in critical condition (as of Saturday).  Alcohol and speed are not believed to be factors in the crash.  The crash remains under investigation.

class.element: Felony DUI/Driving on a Revoked License

Sergio Raul Zavala 25 of Ashburn was charged with Felony DUI Refusal Driving on a Revoked license resisting arrest and falsely identity to law enforcement. A Loudoun deputy conducted a traffic stop after the vehicle Mr. Zavala was observed traveling above the posted speed limit. After the completion of the field sobriety tests Mr. Zavala refused to take a personal breathalyzer test. The suspect then attempted to run from the scene. The suspect was taken into custody. He was being held at the Loudoun Adult Detention Center. C2008007433

class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: Crash occurred on Route 15 northbound just north of Tail Race Road. Tan Lai 29 of Leesburg was operating a 1998 Toyota 4-Runner in the northbound lanes when for unknown reasons; Lais vehicle went into the southbound lanes of Route 15 where it struck a 2002 Buick Rendezvous head-on. The Buick was being operated by Lenore West 51 of Leesburg. Her juvenile daughter was in the passenger seat. The impact sent the Buick rolling down the embankment where it crashed into a fence and reportedly caught on fire. West was trapped inside her vehicle and witnesses were able to extinguish the fire with a fire extinguisher. The Toyota rolled onto its side and was struck by a 1998 Buick LeSabre being operated by Michael Anthony 34 of Leesburg. Mr. Anthony was traveling behind Mr. Lai on Route 15 prior to the crash. Ms. West was airlifted to INOVA Fairfax Hospital for life-threatening injuries. She was listed in critical condition Wednesday evening. Her daughter was treated and released for minor injuries at Cornwall Campus of Loudoun Hospital. Mr. Lai was transported to Loudoun Hospital for serious injuries and remained hospitalized Wednesday evening. Mr. Anthony was treated and released at the scene. Mr. Lai was charged with Reckless Driving. Speed and alcohol do not appear to be factors in the crash. C2008007699

class.element: A Loudoun Sheriff’s Deputy initiated a traffic stop on a suspect vehicle from an assault that occurred earlier this year. The vehicle turned its lights off and disregarded the deputy’s emergency equipment signal to stop. The vehicle proceeded onto the Dulles Toll Road and then exited onto Route 28. The vehicle traveled at a high rate of speed on various roads eventually traveling into Fairfax County VA. The vehicle pulled into an apartment complex on Sunrise Valley Road when the driver and passenger fled on foot. The passenger was apprehended at the scene but was later released. The driver Walter Diaz 20 of Manassas VA was located a short time later near Route 28 by members of the Fairfax County Police Department. Diaz was charged by Loudoun County authorities with stalking felonious assault and speed to elude. He is currently being held in Fairfax County. C2008011225

A deputy observed the suspect driving in an erratic manner on Route 50. The deputy initiated a traffic stop and the vehicle continued to drive. The vehicle began to increase its speed and the driver lost control in the area of the listed location. The vehicle struck a cable box and a fire hydrant. The vehicle continued to drive but was unable to maintain control due to a flat tire. The driver exited the vehicle and fled on foot. A perimeter was established and the Fairfax County Police Department provided aerial support with a helicopter and ground support with a K9 unit. The K9 located the suspect and he was taken into custody. Rodriguez is being held without bond. C2008012280

class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: A 1998 Toyota Camry bearing was struck in the rear while in the left lane of the Route 7 Bypass by a 1990 Nissan 300zx. The Nissan 300ZX was following a tractor trailer in the left lane when the tractor trailer driver observed the Camry in the left lane. The driver of the tractor trailer moved to the right to avoid striking the Camry at which time the Nissan struck the Camry. Witnesses to the crash state that the 1998 Toyota Camry was stopped on westbound Rt. 7 Bypass in the left lane when it was struck from behind. One female occupant of the Toyota Camry was flown from the scene and another female occupant was flown from INOVA Loudoun Hospital at Cornwall after being transported by ambulance from the scene. The male driver of the Camry was transported to INOVA Loudoun Hospital at Cornwall and released. The male driver of the Nissan 300ZX was treated at the scene. Driver of the Toyota Camry Chung Cuu Nguyen 73 of Burke VA was charged with Reckless Driving. Alcohol did not appear to be a factor C2008013641

Witnesses to the crash state that the 1998 Toyota Camry was stopped on westbound Rt. 7 Bypass in the left lane when it was struck from behind. One female occupant the Toyota Camry was flown from the scene and another female occupant was flown from INOVA Loudoun Hospital at Cornwall after being transported by ambulance from the scene. The male driver the Camry was transported to INOVA Loudoun Hospital at Cornwall and released. The male driver the Nissan 300ZX was treated at the scene. Driver the Toyota Camry Chung Cuu Nguyen

class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: Waxpool Rd Ramp To Route 28 South

Deputies responded to the ramp for Waxpool Road eastbound to Rt. 28 southbound for a report of a crash involving entrapment.  Caitlin Hand 18 of Ashburn was operating a 2003 Honda Accord in the left lane when her vehicle crossed into the right lane striking the side of a 1992 Ford Ranger extended cab Pickup operated by John Underwood 32 of Manassas.  The pickup then rotated sideways and rolled onto its roof next to the jersey wall.  Two passengers in the pickup John Everett 53 of Woodbridge who was in the front passenger seat and a juvenile female who was seated behind the driver were airlifted to INOVA Fairfax Hospital where they were listed in critical condition as of Wednesday night.  Underwood was ground transported to INOVA Lansdowne Hospital for treatment.  Hand was uninjured in the incident.  Several witnesses to the incident stated observing the Honda begin losing control prior to contact with the Ford.  Hand was charged with failing to stay in her marked lane 46.2-804.  C2008013880

A perimeter was established and a K9 unit responded to the scene. The driver Joshua D. Larsen 26 of Ashburn was located. Larsen was charged with DUI disregarding a signal to stop driving without a license refusal and reckless driving. Larsen remains held without bond. C2008016086

class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: A deputy observed a motorcycle traveling at a high rate of speed on Route 7 near Sterling Boulevard. The motorcycle then proceeded through a red light and turned onto Augusta Drive. The deputy initiated his emergency equipment to conduct a traffic stop after they observed the motorcycle accelerate. The pursuit continued into the motorcycle when in the area of Algonkian Parkway and Potomac View Road it lost control and crashed. The rider then attempted to flee on foot. The rider Matthew C. McVey 27 of Sterling was later located on Biltmore Place. He was taken to the Lansdowne Campus of INOVA Loudoun Hospital where he was treated and was released to the custody of the Loudoun County Adult Detention Center. McVey is charged with DUI refusal disregarding a signal to stop and driving after forfeiture of license. McVey remains held without bond. C2008016152

The passenger was not located. Galdamez remains held without bond. C2008016154

class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: Loudoun Deputies responded to the area of Bungalow Billiards in Sterling VA to assist with an unknown situation. Upon arrival deputies from Community Resource Unit observed a male subject involved in a possible physical altercation with another individual. During the investigation it was learned the male and female were involved in an apparent domestic situation in the parking lot and citizens fearing for the safety of the victim intervened and held the two on scene while they called the Sheriffs Office for assistance. Community Resource Deputies then learned there was a 7-month-old child who was left inside a car. The male subject Michael J. Budroe 43 of Ashburn VA and female Kristen B. Emanuel 42 of Kansas allegedly left the 7-month-old unsupervised and alone while the two were inside a restaurant for over an hour. Due to weather conditions the child was taken to the hospital for an evaluation and is now in the custody of Child Protective Services. Mr. Budroe and Ms Emanuel were charged with felonious child neglect. Mr. Budroe was also charged with disorderly conduct. Both subjects remain held without bond. C2008017740

C2008018809

class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: Edier J. Oliva-Escobar 24 of Sterling and Gabriel A. Estrada-Rodriguez 28 of no fixed address were charged in connection with larceny from two vehicles. Deputies were called to the area for a report of a GPS and an MP3 player removed from a vehicle. Later the same day around 1630 hours a deputy initiated a traffic stop on a vehicle driving erratically. Items reported stolen were discovered inside the car. Oliva-Escobar was charged with receiving stolen goods and was released on a $2500 bond. Estrada-Rodriguez was charged with grand larceny larceny with intent to sell and vehicle trespassing. He was held without bail at the Loudoun County Adult Detention Center. C2008019896
